TopicTitle: A KSP Movie - The Falling Star

Articles.Content:
Hello, and yes, we are DONE WITH THE MOVIE!

^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

The Falling Star

Disclaimer - This is not the RP Kerbin, as to not offend and/or get a thousand requests for people's own country to be placed in the movie.

Trailer

Three minutes of Eyecandy for all!

Space Program Movie - The Falling Star Trailer

Two nations, the Relta and Falistil are two opposing countries perpetually at war. Usually it's small skirmishes, however, this time a valuable military satellite known as the 'Falling Star' was deorbited by an explosion. It carried top secret Relta data on weapons that would cause widespread destruction on the planet. So now, the Falistil and Relta forces rush to recover the weapons that would give them the upper hand.

And yes, the entire soundtrack is touhou music.

I have no idea why.

________

Devs\' Log

James\' Notes - 7/29/12 - 16:09 - Why make a movie?

Well we\'ve been thinking about making a KSP based movie for a long time now, even back to reboot RP. What with Radion\'s Great Munar War and all the things that were going on, it would\'ve been a great time to make an RP based movie. However, when RP was shutdown, we all kinda went our own way and lost interest. A few months later, however, we all watched the 'KSP War' video on youtube, and it gave me an idea. Instead of moving every individual craft to it\'s location, why don\'t I just use some fancy editing and EDIT IN a whole army? So I messed around with the idea, posted a sole video demonstrating this, and the project began.

So, why the Touhou music? -

Well, on TehLazyPirates I had a newfound love for Touhou, and even did a Let\'s Play Subterranean Animisim with Misterspork on it. With the wide variety of music and every possible genre to choose from, I thought it\'d be a great idea to do a Touhou exclusive soundtrack! Other than that, I have no idea. The soundtrack\'s amazing though, I\'ll link the song\'s we\'ve chosen in a non-spoiler fasion at a later date.

Also the 3 minute trailer is all you\'re getting for now.

It should be enough anyways

James\' Notes -7/29/12 - 21:28 - /sighofrelief

I can\'t tell you how worried I was when I read -

'Please take note that normal recordings of gameplay is not considered Fan-works, it must be original content.'

Good thing i read around some more and saw -

'Gameplay, when used in a manner to tell a story or when containing forms of editing is permitted'

-phew

Status Update! About 10 more minutes of raw footage filmed! I mean, just LOOK at this!

Editing tomorrow, because today we celebrate the public release of the trailer by not doing anything at all.

Video Editing, of course. The last few battles will be massive with about 50 planes and 100 tanks each so it\'d be impossible to do without editing.
Don\'t worry, we aren\'t after your creative content or your work. We do however oppose the idea of people dumping video mission reports here.

Update - Pushing Onwards

With the final 4 minute battle in place, we\'ve set the time goal to 1 hour. The only thing left now is the final battle and credits! The final battle should be the longest battle being at least 15 minutes long, going up to 20 if we\'re crazy enough.

Screenshot from 4 minute stratosphere battle.

You know it! The missile launched planes were interesting to build and fly at least. Not very ideal since I had to refilm a bunch of times.

And yeah, 15 minute battle. The 10 minute tank/air battle was easier since it was just in one area, but this one has 5 stages of battle, and has naval, aerial, and land battles happening all at once. And a superweapon.

THREE MINUTES of filming footage and then editing. Then about 6 hours of rendering and another for uploading. And by tomorrow, it'll be ready.
Good news everyone, THE MOVIE IS FINISHED! We'll be having a movie viewing party later today when the movie is uploaded to youtube. It's been quite the adventure!
